historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt>0) while complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the proven best level (0.10) and reduce k_C_decay to arrest C decline without adding selection pressure (history shows lowering k_C_decay was beneficial when paired with stable U).

Agency is already >0.75 and still rising, but D and C have slightly negative drift; since the best record occurs at U=0.10 and recent tweaks often hurt A, keep U at 0.10 and reduce diversity/complexity decay pressures (without increasing k_DU) to stabilize D and C while preserving high A.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and currently rising (dA/dt>0) while complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record level and reduce complexity/agency decay slightly to stabilize C and sustain A without risking diversity (which is near 1.0).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 threshold and still rising, so we keep U at the proven best (0.10) while making a small, calculated reduction in decay terms (past decay tweaks sometimes hurt, so keep changes minimal) to lock in near-1.0 A without destabilizing C/D.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt < 0) so I’ll keep U at the proven-best 0.10 while slightly reducing selection pressure (k_DU) and diversity decay (k_D_decay) to stabilize D without sacrificing A.

Agency is already very high and still rising; since recent tweaks often hurt A, keep params stable and apply a controlled “challenge phase” by increasing U slightly to test robustness while D is safely near 1.0.

historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but the best record (A=1.0) occurred at lower U=0.10, so I’ll revert U toward that sweet spot while keeping strong C→A and U→A couplings and slightly increasing A_decay to avoid runaway/instability at near-saturation.

Agency is already very high and still rising; since the last U spike to 0.14 caused a noticeable A drop (-0.0091 at Gen 2335.8), we’ll keep U near the best-record 0.10 but add a small, calculated challenge bump while preserving strong complexity→agency coupling and low diversity suppression.

A is already safely >0.75 and rising, but D is collapsing (dD/dt=-0.0112) so I’ll revert U closer to the best-record 0.10 (since U=0.14 previously hurt A) and slightly reduce diversity-decay terms to stabilize D without sacrificing A.

Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and near the best-record regime at U=0.10, but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt=-0.0153) so I’ll slightly reduce selection pressure by lowering U a bit (and keep params essentially at the best-record basin) to stabilize D without sacrificing A.

name: Low-U Agency Conservator
description: This agent crossed the Agency Threshold by minimizing agency loss while keeping complexity and diversity high (A=0.993, C=0.834, D=0.961) in a relatively gentle environment (U=0.08). Its lineage shows repeated sensitivity to difficulty and decay tuning: agency dropped sharply when U was raised (to 0.14) and during multi-parameter perturbations, but it recovered when k_A_decay and k_C_decay were adjusted downward and when k_DU was carefully moderated—consistent with a phenotype that preserves agency through low decay and strong A–U coupling (k_AU=0.99) rather than brute-forcing through high difficulty.
